review.reviewTitle: My preferred web hosting solution for many years now
review.reviewLikes: I've been using Digital Ocean for about 7-8 years. I've recommended it many times. In terms of freedom, it's so far superior to my previous web hosting options (BlueHost, HostGator etc.). It's also brilliant in terms of monitoring (checking uptime for my droplets) and the UI/UX is generally very easy to use and navigate. Pricing is pretty straightforward and easy to understand. I save a huge amount using DigitalOcean versus previous solutions.
review.reviewDislikes: The biggest challenge is probably the onboarding and learning to get set up. That said, the number of resources and learning documents provided by Digital Ocean is unbeatable. If you don't know how to set something up, there's little doubt that you can found out, with a detailed walkthrough document.

review.reviewTitle: Simple, Secure, Versatile and Value for money.
review.reviewLikes: It's simple to use, secure and has services and products that are prefect for my use case. I like their knowledge base too. I like how simple it is to track the performance of my droplets. And I really like the pricing too. I was easily able to setup and get running.
review.reviewDislikes: This isn't a comment about DO as much as about the category: for a newcomer it can be overwhelming to see all the services. Naming conventions, terms, can be simplified to ease the entry process. This goes away as one gets comfortable with the space.

review.reviewTitle: Digital Ocean: Easy to use and Developer friendly Cloud
review.reviewLikes: Digital ocean is very easy to implement, and developer friendly paltform. The pricing is startghtforward and affordable as well. The platform makes it easy to deploy servers, databases and apps without complex configuration. CLI and API featue is very handy for integration and documentation is vast and almost covers everything you need. The predictable and flat-rate pricing is what I enjoyed a lot.
review.reviewDislikes: Its limited GPU offerings and lack of support for AI/ML heavy workflows is something I miss on Digital ocean.

review.reviewTitle: Straightforward, Reliable, but Costs Can Add Up
review.reviewLikes: I really appreciate how easy it is to use the Ubuntu virtual machines. The setup is quick and straightforward, making it very convenient to get a server up and running. DigitalOcean provides a simple and intuitive interface, reliable performance, and good documentation. It's very beginner-friendly while still offering powerful features, which makes deploying and managing applications efficient and accessible.
review.reviewDislikes: The pricing can be relatively expensive for countries like Brazil, and it becomes even more costly when the application needs to scale and handle a high amount of traffic.

review.reviewTitle: Simple and Powerful Cloud Infrastructure
review.reviewLikes: DigitalOcean's offerings are affordable and they offer a wide variety of resources that are easy to configure and use. Their virtual machines (Droplets) typically only take a few minutes to configure before they are ready to use. Their managed load balancer offering works seamlessly with the droplets and has straight forward security rule controls.
review.reviewDislikes: I think there are very few downsides to DigitalOcean

review.reviewTitle: Good Value for Money, Easy Installation
review.reviewLikes: I really appreciate DigitalOcean's App Platform and Spaces. These features prove valuable for deploying client projects within my development agency. I find that DigitalOcean offers a very interesting value for money compared to other cloud competitors. The initial setup of DigitalOcean is quite easy, which is a notable advantage for getting started quickly. Overall, these aspects make our gradual transition from AWS to DigitalOcean supported and justified.
review.reviewDislikes: Databases on DigitalOcean are considered somewhat expensive, especially for small projects. For example, the Postgres database at 15 dollars is seen as a significant expense, to the point that it seems more cost-effective to create your own Docker image to use it.

review.reviewTitle: Easily Implement Scalable Droplets At A Modest Cost
review.reviewLikes: Digital ocean is a convenient and cost effective means of running servers that can be scaled as needed and when needed. I've never encountered an issue with the service itself and have been using it since sometime in 2018.
review.reviewDislikes: I have never had any issues with using DigitalOcean & have only noticed a slight increase in cost since I began using the service 7+ years ago.

review.reviewTitle: Affordable & Efficient for Small Websites
review.reviewLikes: I have been using DigitalOcean for about six months for my personal website, and the experience has been quite positive. I appreciate that DigitalOcean offers a more affordable pricing structure compared to Amazon AWS, especially since AWS has a pricing model that can be quite variable. With DigitalOcean, I have a clear idea of my monthly expenses, which helps me manage my budget effectively. The setup process for DigitalOcean was quite straightforward, similar to AWS, but what stood out was the abundance of tutorials available. These tutorials are incredibly helpful, guiding me through almost every aspect and simplifying the setup process significantly. I also value the droplet feature; despite facing some initial problems with specific template droplets, opting for a regular, non-templated droplet worked perfectly for my needs. The pricing is another major attraction for me, as it provides a cost-effective solution for a small droplet with the right amount of RAM and requirements necessary for a small website. Overall, these aspects make DigitalOcean a favorable choice for my hosting needs.
review.reviewDislikes: I find the storage services offered by DigitalOcean not very competitive compared to Amazon's S3. If I had to choose a storage solution, I'd consider going back to Amazon for that purpose.

review.reviewTitle: Simple when you want to be, but capable when you need it to be.
review.reviewLikes: What I like most about DigitalOcean is the ease of use! Sure, I understand how AWS and GCP works, but those environments can quickly become intimidatingly complex, even for simple things. DigitalOcean strips away that complexity that really helps someone like me, who just wants to focus their energy on their app, not complex infra decisions. That's DO's value for me.
review.reviewDislikes: I have yet to find anything problematic about DigitalOcean's service. There's little nitpicks, maybe, but I have no serious dislikes to mention.

review.reviewTitle: Affordable and Easy Infrastructure Management
review.reviewLikes: I appreciate how DigitalOcean significantly cuts costs compared to other providers, making it a highly attractive option for my budget. This affordability is beneficial as it helps me save money while still fulfilling my hosting needs efficiently. Although I don’t consider myself a power user, I find the platform intuitive enough that I believe I can easily set up new machines if needed. Managing existing infrastructure feels straightforward as well. Moreover, using DigitalOcean to host my website has been a cost-effective solution, aligning perfectly with my financial needs.
review.reviewDislikes: I find the initial setup somewhat challenging, requiring an external article to guide me through it as the support or instructions from DigitalOcean were not readily apparent or sufficient for my needs. Additionally, I am frustrated by the frequent reminders about payments. They make me overly aware of the monthly fee, which becomes annoying since I don't need multiple reminders for this. I've mentioned this concern to DigitalOcean before, but there hasn't been any change, which suggests they are not listening to customer feedback effectively.

review.reviewTitle: Reliable Service, Excellent Support—Database Pricing Worth the Performance
review.reviewLikes: I've been using DigitalOcean products for 3 years and haven't encountered any issues. Their support is responsive, the community is incredibly helpful, and the pricing is fair and transparent.
review.reviewDislikes: There’s not much to complain about, but the database pricing feels a bit high. That said, the performance and reliability make it worth the cost.

review.reviewTitle: Exceptionally Simple and User-Friendly for Beginners
review.reviewLikes: What I appreciate most is the simplicity. For someone just starting out, it's very straightforward and user-friendly. It helps you steer clear of the complexity and confusion that often comes with AWS.
review.reviewDislikes: Some features are still in their nascent stage and need further development. As users, we often find that these are the most common use cases, so it is disappointing when they are not fully supported.

review.reviewTitle: The best IaaS platform I've tried... Absolute minimalism!
review.reviewLikes: DigitalOcean is simply exceptional for its minimalist approach that doesn't sacrifice functionality. What I like the most:Simplicity without compromises: The interface is incredibly clean and intuitive. In minutes you can have a droplet running, without unnecessary complex configurations.Transparent pricing: There are no surprises in billing. You know exactly what you pay for what you use, without hidden costs or confusing pricing structures like other providers.Exceptional documentation: Their tutorials and guides are clear, direct, and really useful. The community and educational content are top-notch.Consistent performance: The droplets have predictable and reliable performance. The SSDs and network work exactly as you expect.Developer-friendly: Perfect for developers who want to focus on building, not struggling with infrastructure. The APIs are simple and well-documented.
review.reviewDislikes: Fewer enterprise services: Compared to AWS or Azure, it has fewer specialized services. But honestly, this is also part of its minimalist charm.Limited support in basic plans: Premium technical support requires more expensive plans, although the documentation makes up for this a lot.

review.reviewTitle: Easy Setup and Fast Support, Perfect for Straightforward Deployments
review.reviewLikes: Getting started with it is straightforward, and configuring everything necessary for a true production-grade deployment is easy. The response time has also been quick whenever I encountered the only issue I've had.
review.reviewDislikes: I appreciate it for what it offers. I use Droplets and make use of the size scaling feature. Personally, I don't find much need for custom node types—keeping the basics straightforward works best for me.

author.authorName: Verified User in Logistics and Supply Chain

review.reviewTitle: Perfect Fit for Small Teams: Reliable, Easy, and Cost-Effective Cloud Hosting
review.reviewLikes:
DigitalOcean has been a great fit for my MERN CRM.

Predictable pricing, quick Droplet spin-ups, and clear docs made deployment simple. I run Node services on Droplets behind a load balancer, store files in Spaces, and use Managed Databases for MongoDB. Performance is solid, scaling up or down takes minutes, and snapshots/backups are painless. The VPC setup keeps internal traffic private, monitoring and alerts are straightforward, and their control panel is fast. Support has been responsive the few times I needed it. For a small team shipping a CRM, it hits the sweet spot of cost, reliability, and ease of use.
review.reviewDislikes: I don't think there are downsides to using DigitalOcean. I avoided the AWS outage and I'm happy I chose DO.

review.reviewTitle: Fast, User-Friendly Platform with Effortless Server Management
review.reviewLikes: DigitalOcean is an amazing platform, It's dashboard is not cluttered or confusing so it's easy to spin up a new server or can manage existing ones without getting lost i technical menus. In DigitalOcean everything runs fast. Even the smallest droplets tend to perform really well and the setup process only takes the few minutes.
review.reviewDislikes: Nothing for now, everything going smoothly.

author.authorName: Verified User in Marketing and Advertising

review.reviewTitle: Simple, Reliable, and Developer-Friendly Cloud Hosting
review.reviewLikes:
DigitalOcean stands out for its simplicity, reliability, and developer-friendly environment. The UI is clean and intuitive, making it easy to deploy and manage droplets even for those who aren’t full-time sysadmins.

Their documentation is top-tier—comprehensive, well-organized, and beginner-friendly, which really speeds up troubleshooting and learning. Pricing is transparent and affordable, especially for small businesses and startups looking to scale gradually. 

I also appreciate their growing ecosystem of products like Spaces, Managed Databases, and Kubernetes support.
review.reviewDislikes: There’s not much to dislike, but if I had to point something out, it would be that some advanced features and monitoring tools are more limited compared to larger cloud providers like AWS or GCP. While that keeps things simpler, power users might miss certain enterprise-grade options or integrations. That said, for the vast majority of use cases, DigitalOcean more than delivers.

review.reviewTitle: Affordable Hosting That Delivers Great Value
review.reviewLikes: Very affordable hosting platform! I tried researching many different platforms to host n8n and this proves to be the best one! It was also very simple to set up.
review.reviewDislikes: Can’t really tell as I haven’t explored it that much.

author.authorName: Verified User in Information Technology and Services

review.reviewTitle: Simple, Affordable, and Reliable Cloud Hosting
review.reviewLikes: What I like best about DigitalOcean is its intuitive and clean interface, which makes managing servers and deployments incredibly straightforward - even for users who aren’t cloud experts. The pricing is also very transparent and affordable, allowing me to scale projects without worrying about unexpected costs. On top of that, the platform’s performance is consistently reliable, with fast server response times and minimal downtime, which is essential for my work.
review.reviewDislikes: While I’m generally very satisfied with DigitalOcean, if I had to mention a downside, it would be that some advanced features and integrations found in larger cloud providers are missing or require more manual setup. Additionally, more detailed documentation or tutorials for certain use cases would be helpful for users looking to expand their projects.

author.authorName: Verified User in Information Technology and Services

review.reviewTitle: Effortless Droplet Setup and Deployment
review.reviewLikes: It can be dead simple. You can get a Droplet running in minutes without having to worry about setting up an internal network, user permissions, etc. Just put your SSH key, and at the end you get a public IP address and a compute node. Selection of droplet combinations are also straightforward.
review.reviewDislikes: Currently, Spaces could use more granular permissions and privileges.

review.reviewTitle: DigitalOcean: User-Friendly and Cost-Effective for Beginners
review.reviewLikes: I absolutely appreciate DigitalOcean for its incredible ease of use, especially since I'm not a coder or someone with a strong computer background. Despite my lack of technical expertise, I found the setup straightforward and intuitively simple, which is why I often recommend it to others. The availability of helpful resources, such as tutorials and a comprehensive help page, ensured I could navigate DigitalOcean effectively, even successfully building databases and setting up projects without prior experience. Additionally, I value the platform's excellent pricing, which is both affordable and fair, further enhancing its appeal. The performance of the droplets is remarkable, with impressive speed and accuracy, which aligns perfectly with my needs. Moreover, DigitalOcean's security features bolster my confidence in the platform. Ultimately, the ability to collaborate seamlessly on projects with my programmer friend, using integration tools like GitHub, is a significant benefit, maintaining efficiency and connectivity across locations.
review.reviewDislikes: There isn't anything for me to say about DigitalOcean.

review.reviewTitle: Flexible, User-Friendly with Room for Improvement
review.reviewLikes: I appreciate how flexible and customizable DigitalOcean is, allowing me to easily transition from other platforms like Python Anywhere. The ease of setup and management, particularly for Linux boxes, has been a significant advantage, enabling me to solve my hosting needs and empowering me to create more web applications. The dashboard is another standout feature that enhances my user experience, making management straightforward and intuitive. I also find the backups extremely useful, providing peace of mind. The support materials, including tutorials available online, have been helpful, and AI tools have made navigating them even easier and more enjoyable. Working with simple yet effective terminal commands and the integration with SSH, Git, GitHub, and Docker enhances my workflow seamlessly. The company's overall vibe is fantastic, with a simple and elegant interface that promotes fun and learning, ticking all the right boxes for me.
review.reviewDislikes: I feel restricted by the inability to downsize a droplet once the disk size has been increased. Even though I understand there are technical reasons for this limitation, it can be frustrating when you upsize for a particular need and realize later that it was unnecessary. This leaves you feeling stuck because you cannot revert to a smaller size. This constraint seems to go against the flexible and empowering vibe that DigitalOcean aims to provide.

review.reviewTitle: Reliability and Simplicity at a Good Price
review.reviewLikes: I have been using DigitalOcean for over eight years and I love the simplicity and clarity of their pricing structure compared to more complex services like Amazon and Google. I chose DigitalOcean for its good price and for offering straightforward services without additional technical complications. I greatly value the ability to scale in space and CPU with the droplets, as well as having full control over tools and connections like SSH, MySQL, and git. This gives me the freedom to efficiently manage software maintenance and the deployment of my web app. I also appreciate the reliability of the service, with uptime that surpasses the providers I previously worked with. I can manage my droplets and create new ones or discard them when I need to, which provides great flexibility. DigitalOcean is a service I highly recommend for its uptime, competitive pricing, and the reliability it offers; I always recommend it to my clients.
review.reviewDislikes: The control of the access ports to the droplet. Until the last time I needed to make a change, it is necessary to ask support for it, you cannot do it yourself as a client. That takes away independence.

review.reviewTitle: Effortless Deployment with Predictable Pricing
review.reviewLikes: I love how DigitalOcean offers predictable pricing, which makes budgeting for hosting costs straightforward and stress-free. The initial cost for a droplet was just $5, which was appealing enough for me to dive into using it without second thoughts. Their user interface is visually appealing and intuitive, which reduces the learning curve and makes managing my projects a pleasure. When I started using DigitalOcean to host my personal website and prototype new products, the setup process was completely seamless, and it has become even simpler over time. I also really appreciate the App Platform's ability to connect directly to my GitHub repository, allowing me to make my website live quickly, which is perfect for rapid iteration and prototyping. DigitalOcean effectively solves my need to deploy applications live on the Internet without the complexities I found in platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, which makes it an indispensable tool for my projects.
review.reviewDislikes: Nothing

review.reviewTitle: Stable and flexible infrastructure for professional projects and automations
review.reviewLikes: DigitalOcean offers a stable and predictable infrastructure, ideal for those working with professional applications and needing full control of the environment. Creating droplets is simple and fast, and the server performance is consistent even under production loads. The integration via API and the dashboard are straightforward, allowing for the automation of routines such as deployments, backups, and monitoring. The cost-benefit is excellent for medium-sized projects and for developers who value technical autonomy without the complexity of larger providers.
review.reviewDislikes: The absence of native support via real-time chat can delay the resolution of critical incidents, especially outside of business hours. It would also be interesting to see improvements in the transactional email panel and more detailed network metrics directly on the dashboard, without relying on external integrations.

review.reviewTitle: Effortless Hosting with Stellar Simplicity
review.reviewLikes: I absolutely love the simplicity that DigitalOcean offers. The setup process is super simple, making it the easiest experience I've ever had with hosting. The available templates are awesome, adding significant value right from the start. I appreciate how straightforward it is to handle storage, with the ability to easily add on storage that simplifies hosting immensely. Moreover, the process is so straightforward that I barely need any documentation. Another fantastic aspect is the straightforward upgrading and scaling. DigitalOcean makes it possible to upgrade either storage or hosting with just one click, which is incredibly convenient. The clear-cut menu system enhances this ease of use further. In terms of software integration, I find it efficient with typical software options like Ubuntu and Apache readily available. Overall, DigitalOcean simplifies complex processes, making my work both efficient and satisfying.
review.reviewDislikes: I would like to see improvement with the process of adding on volumes with DigitalOcean. It requires some coding and manual configuration to make changes and recognize the new volume, which adds complexity. I wish there was a more seamless process where adding a volume would simply expand my space without needing extra steps to configure and refer to the new volume. Additionally, I would appreciate it if DigitalOcean was a bit cheaper.

review.reviewTitle: Exceptional Service and Value with DigitalOcean
review.reviewLikes: I really appreciate the excellent service provided by DigitalOcean. Over the past three months, I've been using it as part of my e-commerce website, and it has been nothing short of commendable. The payment method is also very convenient and valuable. What stands out to me is the exceptional performance, which I find to be the very best in its class. Additionally, the pricing is unbeatable, offering great value compared to other services with higher price points. I haven't encountered any difficulties with the service, and this ease of use adds to the overall positive experience. The quality of service and support is impressive, making DigitalOcean a reliable option for my needs. I have already recommended DigitalOcean to my friends and other potential customers, confident in the knowledge that the service is truly excellent. My experience with DigitalOcean has been nothing short of stellar, prompting a perfect recommendation score of ten out of ten.
review.reviewDislikes: I like the all feturets becouse the service is very good

review.reviewTitle: Effortless Power and Simplicity, But Could Use More Built-In Safeguards
review.reviewLikes: What i like best about digital ocean is how it manages to stay powerful without ever feeling complicated. most cloud providers feel like you are borrowing a spaceship just to deploy a small app, but digital ocean feels more like driving a well built car fast, predictable and completely in your control.
review.reviewDislikes: what i dislike about digital ocean is not the product itself it is that it is almost too lean at times.the simplicity that makes it so refreshing can also leave you wishing for a few more builtin safety nets. for instance,when you are managing multiple environments or scaling quickly,the lack of deeper automation or native cost insights can make you feel like you are flying manual in heavy clouds

review.reviewTitle: Cloud Made Simple and Affordable, Just How I Like It
review.reviewLikes: I really like how straightforward DigitalOcean is. Setting up a Droplet (their virtual server) takes just a few clicks, and the interface is clean enough that I never feel lost. The pricing is transparent-no hidden costs-and starts low enough to fit small projects or startups. Another plus is their huge library of community tutorials and guides, which makes solving issues a lot easier.
review.reviewDislikes: Sometimes the support response time can be slow, especially during busy periods. I’ve also learned to keep extra backups, as I once had a managed database update cause some data loss. And while it’s perfect for simple to medium-scale projects, it lacks some of the advanced features you’d get from bigger cloud providers.

review.reviewTitle: Simple App Hosting and Transparent Pricing, But Some Services Are Costly
review.reviewLikes: DigitalOcean offers a simpified way to host app application through app platform which is simple way to host an application on DigitalOcean App platform, and the other thing the pricing is accurate what the pricing page says is what you will find inside digitalocean unlike other platforms.
review.reviewDislikes: Well on DigitialOcean the most hurting part for me is some of the services have high pricing which some could not handle.
